page.title: 16Local History, Scoutmoor.
page.content: {Edwin Waugh,}who was a prolific writer of stories and poems in the Lancashire dialect, was born in Rochdale in 1817 and died at New Brighton in 1890. The monument of Waugh's Well, located on the right hand side of the Rossendale Way was built in his memory. The well was officially opened in 1866. There is a bronse figurehead of Edwin Waugh with the dates 1817-1890. On the left-hand side there is a plaque which reads "Rebuilt in 1966 in the memory of Ward Ogden, naturalist and rambler",and at the right-hand side is a bronze plaque which reads "In memory of Harry Craven. Ross Endale 1907_1971". Underneath are the words "He left his on memory's page by striving, might and main.Th'owd dialect int'modern/age to foster, an sustain". Edwin Waugh 1817-1890.
